This semester I taught a class on Java programming and tried to 
instill a little bit of JUnit into my students.  On their second 
assignment, I had them write tests for the class they 
implemented in their first assignment. (Yes, I know, that's not 
test first...)  On the second assigment, I ran their unit tests 
against my implementation of the first assignment's class.  I 
used the text user interface as this made batching up the tests 
easier.  However, on inspection of the student's code, I had 
several students whose tests passed, but they didn't actually call 
assert*() or fail().  For example:

public class MP0Test extends TestCase {
  ...
  public void testGetValue() {
      MP0class mp0 = readConfig();
       mp0.getValue() == 42;
  }
}

Does anyone think JUnit should give  some kind of warning 
when no assert* or fail is called in a test* method?

Joel Jones
jones@...
